results.title: Know your library. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Frustration of a girl who has not had elementary school library instruction before entering a large library. Close-ups of library equipment. Stresses library as a centre for materials other than books. Librarian offers help in using the card catalogue, finding books and using reference materials.

results.title: Know your friends, know your enemies
results.creator_credit: Garry Lane, Peter Gray and Crowsfoot Films
results.brief_description: The LaTrobe Valley power workers’ strike in 1977 seriously crippled the State of Victoria. This film analyses the causes of the collapse of a just and seemingly invincible strike through a combination of personal accounts and archival footage.

results.title: Know your baby
results.brief_description: An illustration of approved methods of psychological care of the newborn infant. A home situation is shown where other children are present, and the consideration and understanding necessary until the family adjusts itself to the demands of the newcomer are noted. Many aspects of the care of the infant are dealt with, and their psychological implications stressed, including such points as clothing and bedding, the bath, breast feeding and bottle feeding, maintenance of normal home atmosphere, prevention of any feeling of neglect in older children, and the need to develop the interest and participation of brothers and sisters in the care of the new baby.

results.title: Know the Commonwealth. No. 2. New Zealand
results.brief_description: Two islands at the opposite end of the world to Britain are the home of two races - Maori and British. When first discovered, New Zealand was called the land of the Long White Cloud - the first British people arrived in 1830. New Zealanders are very proud of their unity. Also shows the natural hot water springs and various agricultural industries.

results.title: Knole
results.creator_credit: John Rhodes, Robert Fleming and Thames Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Place in the Country”.
Part of a series of films made in cooperation with the National Trust, this episode looks at Knole through the eyes of the family who has lived there.

results.title: Knockout thrills
results.brief_description: Newsreel footage capturing the closing stages of some historic boxing matches. 1. Gene Tunney versus Georges Capentier (Round 14, 24th of July 1924, Polo Grounds, New York City). 2. Harry Wills versus Paulino Uzcudun (Round 4, 13th of July 1927, Brooklyn, New York City). 3. Jack Dempsey versus Jack Sharkey (Round 6-7, 21st of July 1927, Yankee Stadium, New York City). 4. Joe Louis versus James J. Braddock (Round 7-8, 22nd of June 1937, Chicago).

results.title: Knifecraft
results.creator_credit: Boy Scouts of America. Visual Education Service
results.brief_description: Illustrates the prpoer care and handling of a pocket knife, using the carving of a Katcina Doll lamp as an example. Shows initial preparations, the whittling down of material to rough dimensions, carving detail and the painting of an Indian design to finish the lamp.

results.title: Knife in the water = Noz w wodzie. Repulsion. Cul-de-sac [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Roman Polanski, Gene Gatowski, Stanislaw Zylewicz, Compton and Zespol Camera
results.brief_description: Roman Polanski is a true auteur. Themes of ambiguity, sexual tension, insanity, and everyday tragedy make his surrealistic work inspirational and at the same time controversial. This three disc set presents three of his 1960’s features. “Knife in the water” is Polanski’s first feature. A married couple pick up a hitch hiker. Feelings of claustrophobia and sexual tension result as they are confined on a holiday in a small yacht. A jealous husband turns hostile. In Polish with English subtitles. “Repulsion” a psychological thriller focuses on the illusions and fantasies of a sexually repressed young woman (Catherine Deneuve). Being both repulsed and attracted by sex she has nightmares and horrific visions when alone for several days in her apartment. “Cul-de-sac” a black comedy where a strangely matched couple have their home invaded by two criminals. Life is disrupted by the eccentric and interesting gangsters. Tense and surreal. Cast include Donald Pleasance and Lionel Standing. Titles available on VHS. Title numbers 304192; 315657; 302532.

results.title: Klee Wyck (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Grant Crabtree, Graham McInnes and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: The story of painter Emily Carr, ‘Klee Wyck’ or ‘Laughing One’ to her Indian friends. This famous Canadian artist has found inspiration for her work in British Columbia’s Pacific coast, its forest of giant trees and its Indian villages with their totems and carvings. Her canvases are shown with the scenes where they were painted. Editing, Cecily Sparks. Music, Maurice Blackburn.
